description: An expression that returns a string generated by concatenating between 1 and N values, with a specified or default separator.

$include_nulls.description: Indicates whether to include whether to include `null` or empty value. If true, falsy values will be cast to the string "NONE" before concatenation. Otherwise, `null` values will be omitted entirely and the result string could be `null` if all component parts are also null.

$separator.description: The separator placed between concatenated values. If not provided, a `-` will be used by default.

$values.description: The list of string expressions whose values should be concatenated.
